alert.note: Alert for Pershing (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 1:43PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. East Walker River Above Strosnider Ditch Near Mason affecting Lyon County. Humboldt River Near Imlay affecting Pershing County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River Near Imlay. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, Minor flooding of Tungsten Road south of the river between the river and the Pit Taylor Canal. Some minor low land flooding is occurring very near the river from the Humboldt County line to Rye Patch. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:05 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:05 PM PDT Sunday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady near 10.5 feet this afternoon. It will gradually fall through the week ahead. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when camping or hiking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon.
